meanings.definition: Showing stylishness or elegance in dress
meanings.sent1: She wore the nattiest outfit to the party.
meanings.sent2: He always looks nattiest in his tailored suits.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat looked nattiest with its tiny bow tie.
meanings.sent4: Her garden was the nattiest in the neighborhood, like a fashion show for flowers.
meanings.sent5: The nattiest mannequin in the store window caught everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: Neatly or trimly smart in appearance
meanings.sent1: The nattiest student in class had perfectly ironed clothes.
meanings.sent2: The groom looked nattiest in his crisp tuxedo.
meanings.sent3: The penguin waddled around looking nattiest in its tuxedo-like feathers.
meanings.sent4: The nattiest bookshelf in the library stood out like a well-dressed guest at a party.
meanings.sent5: The nattiest car in the parking lot gleamed under the sun.

meanings.definition: Marked by smartness in dress and manners
meanings.sent1: She was the nattiest guest at the event, charming everyone with her grace.
meanings.sent2: The gentleman was known for being the nattiest in the room.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was the nattiest in the park, always polite and well-groomed.
meanings.sent4: The nattiest peacock strutted around the garden, showing off its colorful feathers.
meanings.sent5: The nattiest waiter at the restaurant made every customer feel special.
